title: First human to walk in space Alexei Leonov dies aged 85
text:
The Russian cosmonaut nearly died several times on his mission in 1965 (Picture: Getty Images/Sovfoto/Universal Images Group/REX)

Alexei Leonov, who made history as the first man to walk in space 54 years ago, has died in Moscow.

Russian space agency Roscosmos confirmed his death on its website but gave no further details.

He performed his spacewalk on March 18, 1965, tethered to his Voskhod 2 capsule as he floated above the earth for just over 12 minutes.

In an interview with the BBC in 2014, he said: ‘You just can’t comprehend it. Only out there can you feel the greatness – the huge size of all that surrounds us.’

The pioneering mission nearly ended in tragedy when his suit inflated, leaving in unable to fit back into his spacecraft.

Alexei Leonov floated in space for about 12 minutes attached by a cord (Picture: Getty Images)

He made history by becoming the first human to walk in space (Picture: REX)

As his suit became looser around his body he couldn’t pull himself back with the cord and it was impossible to get into the airlock.

He nearly starved himself of oxygen by letting air out of his suit through a valve to get back inside.

When it was time to return to earth, the re-entry rockets failed, meaning they had to fire them manually.

The move should have separated the landing capsule, but something went wrong and the rest of the craft was still being dragged behind them as they plummeted in a spinning motion.

Only the heat from re-entry saved them, after burning through a communications cable and releasing them from the orbital module they were dragging behind them.

The team landed in a remote woodland area in Siberia with -25C temperatures which is home to bears and wolves.

But the reality of the dangers faced by the crew only emerged many years later.

His funeral will take place at a military cemetery in Moscow on Tuesday (Picture: AFP/Getty Images)

Alexei Leonov and US crew commander Thomas Stafford shake hands in July 1975 (Picture: NASA/AFP/Getty Images)

He scraped with death multiple times on his first trip into space (Picture: Sovfoto/Universal Images Group/REX)

He went back to space 10 years later, commanding the Soviet Union’s half of the Apollo-Soyuz 19 mission.

It was a joint effort with the United States carried out at the height of the Cold War.

Two Russian crew members on the International Space Station paid tribute to Mr Leonov two days before his 85th birthday.

They ventured into open space with stickers attached to their spacesuits paying tribute to the astronaut and congratulated him from space.

Roscosmos said Mr Leonov’s funeral will take place on Tuesday at a military cemetery outside Moscow.

description: Russian cosmonaut Alexi Leonov, the first human to perform a spacewalk, has died in Moscow at 85 years old.
